properties.areaDesc: Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 8 at 3:24AM PST until January 9 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4
inches.

* WHERE...Surprise Valley California and Northern Lassen County.

* WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Thursday. Snow
accumulations are most likely to occur between 10 PM and 6 AM.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute, especially
for CA-36 and CA-44 west of Susanville, CA-139 and CA-299 in
northern Lassen County, US-395 north of Ravendale, and from
Cedar Pass into the Surprise Valley.
properties.instruction:
Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during
periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to
reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since
it takes longer to stop on slick roadways.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY
